definition: lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to drink/variant of 嗬[he1]
to shout
hot (spicy)/pungent
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life

not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large

affluent/very rich
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
happy/cheerful

to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
living in ease and comfort

to freeload
